intro: Chaerophyllum colensoi var. colensoi, commonly known as the Colenso's cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small white or greenish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
